Package main.utils.iocontrol

Class CSVWritter

java.lang.Object
main.utils.iocontrol.CSVWritter
public class CSVWritter extends Object
A utility class for writing CSV files and returning their contents as a list of rows, each represented as a list of strings.

  • Method Summary

    Method
    Description
    CSVWritter

    Appends a row to the CSVWriter.
    static CSVWritter

    Creates a new instance of CSVWriter and adds a row of headers.

    Writes the accumulated content to a specified file and closes the writer.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Method Details

    • create

      public static CSVWritter create(List<String> headers)
      Creates a new instance of CSVWriter and adds a row of headers. This static factory method is used to conveniently initialize a CSVWriter with a list of header values. The headers are added as the first row in the CSV document.
      Parameters:
      headers - A list of strings representing the header values for the CSV.
      Returns:
      A new CSVWriter instance with the provided headers added as the first row.

    • addRow

      public CSVWritter addRow(List<String> row)
      Appends a row to the CSVWriter. The provided list of strings is joined by commas, wrapped in double quotations, and followed by a newline character.
      Parameters:
      row - A list of strings representing the values of a CSV row.
      Returns:
      This CSVWriter instance to allow method chaining.

    • writeAndClose

      public void writeAndClose(String filePath) throws IOException
      Writes the accumulated content to a specified file and closes the writer. This method takes a file path as a parameter, creates a BufferedWriter to write the content of the CSV document to the specified file, and then closes the writer. It is essential to handle IOException, which may occur during file I/O operations.
      Parameters:
      filePath - The path to the file where the CSV content will be written.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs while writing to or closing the file.
